question.body: Which of the following accurately describes the function of the hypothalamus?

multiple_choice.choice: It is a link between the nervous system and the endocrine system.
It is regulated by the pituitary gland.
It directly regulates all endocrine secretions.
It is responsible for only stimulating the pituitary gland.

response.feedback: Correct. The hypothalamus has both nervous system and endocrine functions and is a link between them.
Incorrect. The hypothalamus can respond to a negative feedback loop but it is not directly controlled by the pituitary gland.
Incorrect. The hypothalamus does not directly control all endocrine secretions, it does regulate the pituitary gland which regulates many other glands.
Incorrect. The hypothalamus secretes both releasing and inhibiting hormones.
